articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Taedonggang Tile Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Taedonggang Tile Factory
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to the Taedonggang Tile Factory built on an expansion basis. 
					 He went round different places of the factory to learn in detail about its construction, operation of its equipment and production.
					
					 He dropped in at the building which houses a microlite shop with a capacity of hundreds of thousands of square meters and artificial marble tile shop, etc.
					
					 He watched with keen interest the process producing large artificial marble tile of same colors and patterns as those of natural marble.
					
					 He learned in detail about the operation of latest equipment giving diverse colors and decorations to large glass-compound tiles and building materials being produced by the way of dressing glass water on them.
					
					 He highly praised the officials and employees of the factory for having successfully carried out the second-phase capacity-expansion project while producing and supplying varieties of tiles to major construction sites including Changjon Street, true to the last instructions of leader Kim Jong Il and the party. By doing so, they have a great contribution to putting the building materials industry on a Juche, modern and scientific basis, he said.
					
					 At the general computer control room he learned about the streamlined production processes.
					
					 He was satisfied to hear that the factory is the one of Korean-style both in name and reality as it calcinates tiles by gasifying coal abundant in the country, i.e. the one entirely relying on locally available raw materials.
					
					 He underlined the need to continue directing big efforts to improving the quality of products, noting that the quality of tiles depends on plane and right angle tolerable numerical value, contraction rate, intensity and resistance to cold.
					
					 He also went round other shops producing tiles for outer and interior walls and floor and marble tiles.
					
					 While seeing tiles of diverse colors and sizes, he expressed great satisfaction, figuratively speaking, all clothes and underwear are locally made.
					
					 He looked round the tile exhibition at the factory.
					
					 He said while looking round the factory he learned that the officials of the factory were working in a big way, proud of their job and having an enterprising and progressive work style.
					
					 This is real patriotism, he noted, adding he was pleased with the ardent patriotism displayed by the officials and other employees of the factory. 
					
					 Saying that the factory is the nation's leading comprehensive building materials production base, he underscored the need to channel efforts to boosting the production of tiles, increasing their varieties and improving their quality.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Bok, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Ryong Ha, Pak Thae Song, Kim Pyong Ho, Jang Su Gil and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Concert of Female Brass Band of KPISF
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Concert of Female Brass Band of KPISF
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, guided the concert of the female brass band of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF).
					 He, together with his wife Ri Sol Ju, appeared in auditorium.
					
					 There was a ceremony of the band entry, depicting the star of Marshal to the tune of song "Look at Us."
					
					 The concert began with wind music "Let Our Party Flag Flutter Vigorously" and "Glory to Our Great Party."
					
					 Put on the stage were trumpet solo "We Will Follow You Single-mindedly", brass music "Our Leader Loved by People", brass quartet "General on a Galloping White Horse", trombone solo "The Country I Am Defending", wartime serial songs "Song of National Defence", "A Soldier and a Girl",  "Advance", "At the Spring Site", "Song of Mother" and "Nobody Knows", brass music "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" and "Song of Thanks" and brass music and rhythm "Let Youth Run Like Express Train."
					
					 The performers successfully represented the great pride and self-esteem of the servicepersons of the KPISF who live and struggle as revolutionary soldiers of the party and leader and protectors of people and powerfully demonstrated the might of the KPISF reliably defending the gains of the socialist country and the security of the people, standing guard over the outpost of the class struggle.
					
					 The concert, a combination of well-organized change of formation and dynamic and peculiar rhythms, successfully presented refined rendition ability. 
					
					 He waved back to the performers, congratulating them on their success in the concert.
					
					 He appreciated their laudable merits, saying they powerfully encouraged the service personnel and people in the struggle to defend the socialist country and drive for building a rich and powerful country and successfully ensured important events in the past.
					
					 The combination of brass band music with artistic rhythm peculiar to the women's brass band is good, he noted, giving an instruction to create diverse and attractive rhythms as it is popular among people.  He called on the creators and musicians of the band not to forget the nature of revolutionary military band in their playing including music composition and arrangement to suit its mission and characteristic feature.
					
					 He said that they should intensify their performing activities while pooling their wisdom and efforts to improve their skills and thus creditably perform their duty as the band grown up under the care of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and belief that the creators and musicians of the band would more loudly and dynamically play revolutionary military music to arouse all the servicepersons and people to accomplish the Songun revolutionary cause of the Party.
					
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Bok, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Ryong Ha, Pak Thae Song, Kim Pyong Ho and Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un Friday received a message of greeting from Lao President Choummaly Sayasone. 
					 The message said:
					
					 Dear Comrade,
					
					 It gives me pleasure to send on behalf of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, the government and people of Laos and on my own behalf warm congratulations and best wishes to you and, through you, to the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK government and all fraternal Korean people on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Very pleased that the good and traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between Laos and the DPRK are growing stronger on a new high stage, I would like to express belief that such relations would develop day by day in conformity with the interests of our two peoples and peace, stability and cooperation of the region and the world.
					
					 I, availing myself of this happy occasion, would like to wish you good health and happiness and steady new greater victory in the noble cause of leading the defence and building of socialism in the DPRK and the struggle for achieving the peaceful reunification of Korea. 
					
					 I renew the assurances of highest consideration to you.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Message of Greeting from Myanmar President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Message of Greeting from Myanmar President
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a message of greeting from Thein Sein, president of Myanmar, on Aug. 22.
					 He in the message extended warm congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the people of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on behalf of the Myanmar people and on his own behalf on the auspicious occasion of the 64th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 I, availing myself of this opportunity, would like to sincerely wish Your Excellency good health and success and the DPRK steady progress and prosperity, the message said.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chinese Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a gift from the All-China Journalists Association.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned on August 31 by Huang Libiao, president of China Women Newspaper, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Hopes for Friendly Relations with Vietnam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Hopes for Friendly Relations with Vietnam
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Truong Tan Sang, president of Vietnam, on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					 Kim in the message said that the Vietnamese people have registered big successes in the efforts for building a modern industrialized country by the year 2020.
					
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries which have a long history would favorably develop by their joint efforts, wishing the Vietnamese president good health and big success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on its national day.
					 Kim in the message wished the people of Uzbekistan welfare and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Slovak President
articles.content:
Greetings to Slovak President
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Ivan Gasparovic, president of Slovakia, on its constitution day.
					 Kim in the message wished the president and the people of Slovakia successes in their work for the country's development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Vietnamese PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Vietnamese PM
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Primer Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greeting to Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the prime minister and the government of Vietnam greater success in the work to carry out the industrialization and modernization of the country.
					
					 On the same day, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his counterpart Pham Binh Minh.

articles.title: Greetings to Slovak FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Slovak FM
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Saturday sent a message of greeting to Slovak Foreign Minister Miroslav Lajcak on the occasion of its Constitution Day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would favorably develop thanks to their joint efforts.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Indonesia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A public health delegation of the DPRK led by Minister of Public Health Choe Chang Sik left here on Saturday to take part in the 30th Meeting of Health Ministers of Southeast Asian Regional Countries of the World Health Organization  and its 65th General Assembly to be held in Indonesia.
					 Meanwhile, Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labour Party, and his party flew back on the same day.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful in World Taekwon-Do Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful in World Taekwon-Do Championships
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK players proved successful at the 10th World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship and the 5th World Veteran Taekwon-Do Championship in Tallin, Estonia from August 20 to 26.
					 The championships brought together hundreds of men and women players from 71 countries of the world.
					
					 The DPRK players placed first in country standing in the Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship.
					
					 The DPRK players won 18 gold medals, 2 silver medals and 4 bronze medals in the Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championship.
					
					 Han Tae Bom and Kim Kum Jong received technique prizes for man and woman of the championship for showcasing excellent technique.
					
					 DPRK players gained good results in the Veteran Taekwon-Do Championship.
					
					 Ri Sun Ok came first in gold class veteran's pattern first degree and 60kg-category sparring match while Kim Jong Sun placed first in silver class women's 68kg-category sparring event.
					
					 They returned home on Saturday.

articles.title: Anniversary of Koryo Songkyunkwan Academy Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Koryo Songkyunkwan Academy Marked
						
 Kaesong, September 1 (KCNA) -- Koryo Songkyunkwan Academy in Kaesong City, Korea, marked the 1 020th anniversary of its foundation.
					 The academy was the highest educational institution of the state built in the period of Koryo.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung visited Kaesong City on May 5, 1992. He said that it was necessary to show that there is actually an academy which carried forward Songkyunkwan Academy in Korea, named the academy and indicated the year of its founding.
					
					 He pointed to the faculty and courses and specified tasks and ways to develop the academy into the University of Light Industry. He personally wrote the name of the university with a writing brush. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il solved the issues arising in constructing a new building of the university and managing and operating it and took deep care of its teachers and students so that they might effect innovations in education and study.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un wisely led the construction of the new building of the academy as a monumental edifice in the era of Songun and made sure that its founding anniversary was significantly celebrated.
					
					 A meeting took place on Saturday.

articles.title: Competition among Art Groups of UAW Held
articles.content:
Competition among Art Groups of UAW Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A competition among art groups of primary organizations of the Union of Agricultural Workers (UAW) was held here on Aug. 30 and 31.
					 The competition brought together members of art groups of primary organizations of the UAW highly appreciated at provincial, city and county competitions.
					
					 They staged colorful numbers.
					
					 They sang high praises of the revolutionary careers and undying feats of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in their group recital of poems and choruses and female solos.
					
					 In poem and story-telling "Great Persons of Mt. Paektu and Our Samjigang", female solo and pangchang "This Is Thanks to the Songun Politics of General", poem and song "Boundless Is Our Yearning" the performers successfully represented their yearnings for the great persons of Mt. Paektu who exalted the dignity of the DRPK and brought the people's happiness in full bloom, deeply impressing the audience.
					
					 Put on the stage were also numbers on the theme of class education.

articles.title: Seriously Burned Baby Cured Thanks to Help of Service Personnel
articles.content:
Seriously Burned Baby Cured Thanks to Help of Service Personnel
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A barely eight-month old   baby Hwang Tae Hung who had been in critical conditions with serious burns, was completely cured and left a hospital attached to the Yongyu Mine of the DPRK on August 31 amid the blessings of people. 
					 It was in June last that the boy was admitted to the hospital with three degree burns on 22 percent of his body.
					
					 Medical workers of the hospital channeled all their efforts into treating him. A few days later he recovered his sense and overcame septic pyemia. Then skin grafting started. Employees of the hospital, inhabitants, officials of the mine and many other people vied with each other to donate their skin.
					
					 Upon hearing the news, service personnel of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces rushed to the hospital and donated their skin to save the boy. Doctors declined the offer of skin by them. But their stubborn insistence made doctors graft more than 150 pieces of skin to the baby. Soldiers' help was not confined to this. They also sent a cradle and made every sincere effort to enrich the baby's nutrition. Their families, too, contributed to the skin-grafting.
					
					 The more than 80 days of treatment of the baby was a period which witnessed the true picture of society in the DPRK which achieved the great unity of the army and the people.

articles.title: Independence against Imperialism Is Banner of Victory for NAM: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Independence against Imperialism Is Banner of Victory for NAM: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Saturday carries a bylined article on the lapse of 51 years since the non-aligned movement (NAM) started its historic advance.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The movement has covered the road of ceaseless advance and victory upholding the banner of independence against imperialism despite the imperialists' vicious challenges and the complicated international situation. 
					
					 The movement that first grouped 25 countries has now developed into the most powerful anti-imperialist independent forces in our era with 120 members.
					
					 The movement set forth the independence against imperialism as its basic idea ever since its foundation.
					
					 At that time, cold war system dominated the international arena due to the acute showdown between the two world's superpowers. 
					
					 The imperialists worked hard to form military blocs for aggression and dominate the world by dint of them. To cope with this, a military bloc led by the Soviet Union was established. This has escalated confrontation and contradictions between military blocs on the international arena. Many countries in the world including newly independent countries voiced their will not to take part in any military bloc and called for opposing the establishment of foreign military bases in their countries. 
					
					 This is the backdrop against which the movement was emerged which took up organized form over years.
					
					 The movement has won victory after victory for decades as it has firmly preserved the idea and fundamental principle of independence against imperialism.
					
					 Confrontation between forces standing for war and aggression and those forces hoping for peace against aggression has escalated on the international arena.
					
					 As long as the imperialists' high-handed and arbitrary practices and unilateralism are allowed in the world, it will be impossible to realize the desire of mankind for independence and peace.
					
					 NAM should uphold the banner of independence against imperialism and wage dynamic actions to achieve its sacred cause.
					
					 Sure is its victory as it advances under the banner of independence against imperialism.

articles.title: U.S. Nature as Nuclear Criminal Exposed by Declassified Documents
articles.content:
U.S. Nature as Nuclear Criminal Exposed by Declassified Documents
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- It was recently disclosed that the U.S. worked out a plan to spray nuclear materials on the Korean Peninsula during the last Korean War. This has touched off towering indignation of all the Koreans.
					 Report "radioactive warfare" drew up by the U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation on April 20, 1951 said the U.S. planned to spray massive radioactive materials including plutonium and nuclear waste in areas dividing the Korean Peninsula as the Korean war ignited by it was pushed to a deadlock. It carried out 65 field tests before 1952, according to the report.
					
					 These shuddering criminal acts of the U.S. imperialists clearly point to their nature as a war criminal who regards nuclear weapons as a tool for realizing the ambition for hegemony.
					
					 The U.S. dropped atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in August 1945, becoming the world's first nuclear criminal that inflicted unheard-of nuclear disaster on humankind.
					
					 To redress its repeated defeats in the Korean War, the U.S. imperialists hatched a shocking plot to use nuclear weapons on the Korean Peninsula. They have since kicked up a nuclear racket against the DPRK.
					
					 The truth about the monstrous crime planned by the U.S. has been brought to light by secret documents worked out by it.
					
					 A "top-secret diplomatic document" drafted by the U.S. State Department said the U.S. discussed the plan for using A-bombs on six occasions during the war.
					
					 During his inspection of the Korean front in December 1952, Eisenhower openly hinted at the use of nuclear weapons and even prepared "Eisenhower offensive" envisaging the mobilization of weapons of mass destruction.
					
					 Korean war-related documents declassified by the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency and confidential documents discovered at the U.S. national archives show that the U.S. nuclear weapon was first deployed in south Korea in mid-August 1950 and in November the same year the then U.S. President Truman talked to reporters that the use of A-bomb is under constant examination. MacArthur was also proved to have said that there was a plan to drop 30-50 A-bombs in Korea-China border.
					
					 There are also records that U.S. air force's B-29s held A-bomb dropping exercises in the sky above Pyongyang in September and October 1951 and that the U.S. air force made reports from May to July 1953 on the progress made in the A-bomb plan.
					
					 It was written in a diary of the then U.S. air force commander in Far East that the operational study room of the U.S. Department of Army analyzed in detail the issue of tactically using A-bomb in the close ground support operations from September 1950. There are also data showing that the U.S. made detailed examination of the use of nuclear weapons in the Korean War.
					
					 There revealed in succession documents and data exposing the U.S. persistent provocations for a nuclear war even after the end of the Korean War.
					
					 Top-secret operational plan 8-53 laid out by the U.S. Strategic Air Command right after the armistice envisaged the massive drop of nuclear bombs in Korea and China.
					
					 When EC-121 large spy plane incident broke out, the U.S. worked out emergency nuclear attack plan in June 1969. The plan envisaged attacks on airfields and naval bases of the DPRK with 0.2-70 kt nuclear weapons and, furthermore, rendering the most of its military capacity ineffective.
					
					 The confidential document of the U.S. Pacific Command that was declassified in 2006 also clarified that the U.S. moved to use nuclear weapons against the DPRK in 1975.
					
					 A U.S. military confidential document drafted on December 9, 1998 also clarified that the U.S. air force planes deployed in a military base in North Carolina State of the U.S. staged exercises simulating nuclear attacks on the targets of the DPRK several times from January to June that year. It was said that biological and chemical weapons attack operation was also included in the exercises.
					
					 Another U.S. military confidential document--support team for weaponry for south Korea-standard procedures for nuclear operations in south Korea-- which was declassified in December 2010 proved that nuclear weapons had been in deployment in a U.S. military base in Chunchon till April 2005.
					
					 According to a data clarified by a U.S. organization when demanding the U.S. Pacific Command open to public information, 3 million depleted uranium bombs are stockpiled in the U.S. air force military bases in Suwon, Osan, Chongju and other areas of south Korea.
					
					 The depleted uranium bombs with massive destruction power have been used without hesitation in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. forces fired depleted uranium shells and dropped depleted uranium bombs 60 hours per week in the firing ground that existed in Maehyang-ri, Kyonggi Province, leaving a lot of people dead or wounded and destroying hundreds of houses. Even after the closure of the firing ground, inhabitants in this area are suffering from all kinds of diseases including radioactive contamination.
					
					 Nuclear Posture Review worked out by the U.S. in January 2002 shocked people.
					
					 A secret report submitted to Congress by the U.S. Defense Department said that the U.S. can preempt a nuclear attack on seven countries including the DPRK even though those countries do not have nuclear weapons and the U.S. is not directly attacked by nuclear weapons. The document stressed the need to develop and use new smaller nukes capable of destroying underground bunkers and work out a research plan and resume nuclear test.
					
					 The report also contained the fact that formations of F-16 fighter bombers belonging to the U.S. 8th combat air division stationed in the U.S. air force base in Kunsan, south Korea received the training of attacking the DPRK with B-61 nuclear bombs.
					
					 South Korean and other world media denounced the report, saying that "it is shuddering" and "the danger of a nuclear war is becoming a reality". The report disclosed the U.S. true nature as a nuclear fanatic.
					
					 All facts prove that the U.S. has worked hard to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK after making the nuclear war a fait accompli from long ago.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are matchless beasts and nuclear criminal who would not hesitate to inflict nuclear disaster on humankind and exterminate other nation to meet their ambition for aggression and realize their strategy for world domination.
					
					 The U.S. warmongers prodded the south Korean puppet regime, its colonial stooge, to hold reckless DPRK-targeted nuclear war exercises such as Ulji Freedom Guardian, increasing the danger of nuclear holocaust in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Nuke should be answered with nuke.
					
					 The present situation proves that there is no other choice for the DPRK but to bolster nuclear deterrent for self-defense to safeguard its sovereignty and dignity.

articles.title: Japanese Map and Textbooks Discovered to Refute Japan's Claim to Tok Islets
articles.content:
Japanese Map and Textbooks Discovered to Refute Japan's Claim to Tok Islets
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Independence Museum of south Korea discovered and opened to public a Japanese map and textbooks on Aug. 28 proving Japan's unjust claim to Tok Islets according to the south Korean newspaper Daily Economy.
					 The Japanese map in the volume 2 of the newly compiled geographical description in 1887 showed that it underlined islands of Japan to indicate that they belong to its territory whereas it marked Tok Islets in the same way as it did Ullung Island, making it clear that they belong to the territory of Korea.
					
					 The geography textbook for primary schools published by the then Ministry of Education of Japan in 1905 did not mark Tok Islets as part of its territory.
					
					 The "Japanese history", the textbook screened by the Ministry of Education in 1886, had no description of Tok Islets.
					
					 The museum said "the results of the review and analysis of the recently discovered books can confirm Japan had no territorial intent on Tok Islets at that time".

articles.title: S. Korean Teachers and Students Call for Campaign for Defending Tok Islets
articles.content:
S. Korean Teachers and Students Call for Campaign for Defending Tok Islets
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Teachers and students of Tanwon High School, Ansan City, Kyonggi Province of south Korea, held a meeting on August 27, declaring that they would take part in the campaign to defend Tok Islets.
					 In a resolution the participants denounced Japan for making desperate efforts, while claiming the dominium over Tok Islets despite the Korean nation's strong protest and censure.
					
					 Tok Islets are part of an inviolable territory of Korea in the light of historical fact and international law, the resolution noted.
					
					 It is unreasonable to turn Tok Islets into a region of international dispute, it said, calling for turning out in the campaign for defending Tok Islets.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Assails Japanese PM's Reckless Remarks over Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Assails Japanese PM's Reckless Remarks over Its Past Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea held the Wednesday rally outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Aug. 29 at which it condemned Japan for shamelessly denying its sexual slavery in the past.
					 Speakers at the rally accused Japanese Prime Minister Noda of making such reckless remarks as concealing Japan's crimes and negating its historic facts, claiming that there is no evidence proving the Imperial Japanese Army's forcible drafting of Korean women.
					
					 They demanded the prime minister and ultra-right elements immediately apologize for having evaded the responsibility for Japan's sexual slavery and letting loose outbursts against humanity.
					
					 The council issued a statement in denunciation of the prime minister's reckless remarks on Aug. 28.
					
					 The statement termed remarks made by Noda to cover up Japan's past sexual slavery a foolish behavior to write off its crimes against humanity.
					
					 Japan will remain a disgraceful pronoun in human history as it has made no apology for its monstrous crimes, it said, urging Japan to fulfil its legal responsibility for redeeming its past crimes.

articles.title: S. Korea's Moves to Turn Int'l Conference into Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Theater under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korea's Moves to Turn Int'l Conference into Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Theater under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime is set to turn the International Pen Conference due in south Korea in mid-September into the theater of anti-DPRK "human rights" racket. In this regard a spokesman for the Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Saturday:
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is working hard to intensify the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket with the Conference as a momentum.
					
					 The south Korean regime openly says that it "plans to project the north's human rights issue", while trying to draw the "Pen Center of Defectors from the North" consisting of human scum into the International Pen Club. It also moves to present such sinister anti-DPRK burlesque as "work" and "performance" by instigating them.
					
					 Even the south Korean authorities and the candidate to "presidency" from the "Saenuri Party" are moving to join them to fan up the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.
					
					 This is an intolerable insult to the sacred writing activities based on justice, conscience and truth and revelation of the sordid intention to escalate confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 The Central Committee of the Writers Union of Korea bitterly denounces the above-said plot of the Lee regime as an unethical crime against reunification that tramples down on human civilization and intellectuality and escalates confrontation between the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 By nature, the Lee regime has no face to talk about human rights.
					
					 The south Koreans are deprived of elementary freedom and rights as human being
					
					 South Korea has turned into the biggest graveyard of human rights by unpopular rule and harsh suppression of the media and writing activities by the puppet regime.
					
					 South Koreans' grievances are sky-high and the puppet regime is fated to its end.
					
					 It is ridiculous for such guys who are more dead than alive to try to turn the conference into a theater for kicking up anti-DPRK smear campaign.
					
					 The Conference should never be a plaything of the puppet regime which is hell-bent on confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 It should pay due attention to the harsh suppression of the media and the grim human rights situation in south Korea where freedom of speech is wantonly violated and elementary human rights are abused.
					
					 If the Conference turns away from these issues and is misused for meeting the Lee regime's sinister intention for confrontation, this will be little different from undermining the idea and image of the International Pen Club aspiring after the worldwide writers community.
					
					 All the Koreans including the conscientious writers in the north, south and abroad should never allow the Lee group to turn the international conference into the theater of confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 The DPRK expects that the fair public and intellectuals of the world would extend support to the Koreans in their efforts for reconciliation, unity and reunification against the anti-DPRK smear campaign by the south Korean conservative regime.

articles.title: S. Korean Unionists Protest against Violence against Workers
articles.content:
S. Korean Unionists Protest against Violence against Workers
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Unionists of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally outside the Ansan City Office of Kyonggi Province on August 28 in protest against company owners' violence against workers.
					 At the rally speakers accused an enterprise in Ansan of hurling gangsters into violence against workers demanding the guarantee of their vital rights and sacked them. One month has passed since then but they are now allowed to go back to the enterprise, they charged, deploring similar violence is taking place at various worksites.
					
					 They declared they would never tolerate such violence by capitalists.
					
					 All the unionists under the KCTU and other people will get united and stage positive actions to have the situation settled.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants rushed to the enterprise which had expelled the workers and staged a protest.
					
					 The police frantically suppressed the protesters, spraying tear liquid, but they offered stubborn resistance, cutting off wire entanglements around the enterprise.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Will Last Forever: Russian Magazine
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Will Last Forever: Russian Magazine
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Russian magazine World of Diplomacy No. 6 carried a special write-up on the feats of President Kim Il Sung.
					 It carried his smiling portrait and photos of him making a speech after his triumphal return home following the liberation of the country and talking with workers. 
					
					 It said as follows in the article entitled "Immortal feats of Comrade Kim Il Sung".
					
					 The eternal President of the DPRK Comrade Kim Il Sung is a benevolent father of the people who devoted his all to the freedom and happiness of the people.
					
					 He was born on April 15, 1912 at Mangyongdae, Pyongyang.
					
					 He keenly experienced the sorrow and misery of the Korean people and embarked on his revolutionary life in his early days.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea and regarded it as a guiding principle in leading the revolution and construction.
					
					 He is not only a founder of the revolutionary army but also a defender of the DPRK.
					
					 He founded the party and state and achieved the unbreakable unity of leader, party and popular masses.
					
					 He set forth national reunification as a national task and aroused the whole nation to the drive for national reunification.
					
					 He made an immortal contribution to global independence.
					
					 His revolutionary feats will last forever in the hearts of the Korean people.

articles.title: Songun Policy of DPRK Introduced by Different Countries
articles.content:
Songun Policy of DPRK Introduced by Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups with leader Kim Jong Il's photo between Aug. 23 and 25 on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of his start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 L'Avenir, newspaper of Democratic Congo, carried a photo of the dear respected Kim Jong Un inspecting units of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The newspaper in an article titled "DPRK Lauds leader Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership" said the DPRK became a political and military power which can beak back any provocations of hostile forces under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Lao newspaper Congtap Pasason Lao said in an article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il's Songun policy and progress of the DPRK" that the Korean people have brought about big changes in socialist construction under the Songun policy of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A newspaper of Uruguay La Juventud introduced the Songun leadership feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. It said:
					
					 Thanks to the enormous might of Songun, the DPRK is exercising its sovereignty in the international arena and advancing along the road of independence, road of socialism without any deflection.
					
					 The Songun policy of the DPRK is displaying its tremendous might in the field of the politics and military affairs as well as economy and culture.
					
					 Today the DPRK is holding Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un in high esteem who is identical to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Indian newspaper Passion India in articles titled "The undying Songun feats", "The Devoted Traces" and "Songun Korea" lauded the immortal feats performed by Kim Jong Il who unfolded the new era of prosperity unprecedented in the 5,000-year-long history of Korea.

articles.title: Events Mark Anniversary of Peru-DPRK Friendship Organization
articles.content:
Events Mark Anniversary of Peru-DPRK Friendship Organization
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- An event was held in Peru on Aug. 23 to celebrate the 42nd anniversary of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship.
					 Taken part in the event were figures of Peruvian solidarity and friendship organizations with the DPRK including the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute, Kim Jong Suk Library of Peru and Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and masses.
					
					 Invited there were the DPRK ambassador to Peru and the staff members of the DPRK embassy in the country.
					
					 Yuri Cesar Castro Romero, secretary general of the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, and other speakers lauded the immortal feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for the Korean revolution and human cause of independence.
					
					 As the DPRK is led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, it could become a beacon of hope for the world progressives aspiring after the world peace and stability, they said, elaborating on successes made in the development of relations with the DPRK.
					
					 They paid profound homage to the great men of Mt. Paektu who always showed great interest in the development of the friendly ties between the DPRK and Peruvian people, and extended thanks to Kim Jong Un leading the efforts for global independence against imperialism.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Organizations Oppose U.S.-S. Korean Joint War Drills against DPRK
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Organizations Oppose U.S.-S. Korean Joint War Drills against DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi organizations issued statements on Aug. 22 condemning the U.S.-south Korean joint war drills Ulji Freedom Guardian.
					 Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea in its statement said the war drills of the U.S. and south Korea are a threat to peace of not only the Korean Peninsula and the Asia-Pacific region but the whole world.
					
					 The statement urged the U.S. and south Korea to immediately end the joint war drills targeting the DPRK, if they sincerely want peace.
					
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy said as follows:
					
					 The joint war drills once again show that the U.S. and south Korea are the wreckers of peace and warmongers who invite a war.
					
					 The touch-and-go situation in the Korean Peninsula evidently proves the justness of the Songun policy which turned the DPRK into a military power possessed of self-defensive war deterrent.
					
					 We urge the U.S. and south Korea to immediately accept the proposal for the peace agreement for durable peace in the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Organizations of Peru and Bolivia Support DPRK
articles.content:
Organizations of Peru and Bolivia Support DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Peru and Bolivia made public statements in denunciation of the U.S.-south Korea Ulji Freedom Guardian joint war drills for aggression on the DPRK.
					 The Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting’s Union and the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute in a joint statement on Aug. 22 said it was hard fact that the joint military exercises of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces were armed provocations aiming at the preemptive attack.
					
					 However, the U.S. war scenario for aggression will never work on the DPRK, the statement said.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK, true to the order of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, will annihilate the enemies to the last one if the warlike forces of the U.S. and south Korea fire even a bullet into the inviolable territory of the DPRK, it stressed.
					
					 They vehemently denounced the Ulji Freedom Guardian war drills and extended full support and solidarity to the army and people of the DPRK in their just struggle to drive out the aggressors and reunify the country.
					
					 The Bolivia-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on Aug. 23 denounced the madcap U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises for aggression, branding them as dangerous provocations to the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and rest of the world.
					
					 The U.S. and its stooges will not be able to break the idea and will of the Korean people advancing under the banner of the Juche idea, the statement concluded.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Restaurante Haemaji a punto de inauguracion
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Restaurante Haemaji a punto de inauguracion
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio con su esposa      Ri Sol Ju el Restaurante Haemaji en visperas de inauguracion.
					Recorriendo varios puntos del restaurante, se cercioro de la calidad de ejecucion de la obra, la exhibicion de mercancias, el plan de servicio, las variedades y la calidad de platos.
					
					Estuvo primero en el supermercado donde se venden frutas, verduras, productos lacteos y de carne, bebidas alcoholicas.
					
					Diciendo que el supermercado fue acondicionado peculiar e ingeniosamente y las mercancias fueron exhibidas originalmente, se mostro muy satisfecho de que ese centro comercial haya sido acondicionado perfectamente como ejemplo.
					
					Subrayo que para la operacion normal del supermercado, es muy importante que se fijen bien los precios de alimentos y se establezca correcta estrategia de negocio.
					
					En un quiosco probo personalmente la rosita de maiz calificando de delicioso su olor.
					
					En el comedor senalo que estan hechos de modo comodo y apacible la iluminacion del techo, el adorno de pared y el moblaje.
					
					Al ver el plato de arroz mezclado con picadillo de carne y especias, se puso contento diciendo que eso les gustaria mucho a los habitantes.
					
					Recorrio con profunda atencion la tienda de carne y pescado que vende los pescados frescos y los productos hechos con varias partes de la carne.
					
					Subio al segundo piso por la escalera giratoria, el Mariscal recorrio uno tras otro los cuartos de comer que ofertan los platos de varios paises del mundo.
					
					Me gustan mucho estos cuartos que fueron acondicionados tomando en cuenta la nacionalidad de los respectivos paises, dijo.
					
					En el quiosco de venta de panes sabrosos de alta calidad, apunto que la vitrina se ha hecho original e ingeniosamente para asegurar perfectamente la higiene y el confort.
					
					Sentado en una silla en la cafeteria, dijo que se siente tranquilo.
					
					Se mostro muy satisfecho reiterando que son perfectas y le agradan todas las cosas del restaurante, inclusive el ambiente.
					
					Expreso agradecimiento a los constructores militares que edificaron esta magnifica creacion a las alturas del nuevo siglo y a los funcionarios de sectores correspondientes que lo acondicionaron de modo impecable conforme al proposito del partido.
					
					Kim Jong Un presento las tareas que se presentan en la administracion y la operacion del restaurante.
					
					Le acompanaron en la ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Han Kwang Bok, Han Kwang Sang, Kim Kyong Ok, Pak Thae Song y Kim Pyong Ho.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita biblioteca electronica en pabellon de armamentos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita biblioteca electronica en pabellon de armamentos
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio la biblioteca electronica nuevamente acondicionada en el Pabellon de Armamentos del EPC.
					Visitando una por una varias salas de la biblioteca, el averiguo en detalles el estado de construccion y operacion de ella.
					
					Se mostro satisfecho de la construccion magnifica de ese establecimiento moderno en lo conveniente a los requerimientos de la epoca de economia basada en intelectualidad, diciendo que son perfectos el diseno y la calidad de ejecucion de la obra y todos los equipos satisfacen los requisitos cientifico-tecnicos. 
					
					Esta biblioteca, que facilita todas las condiciones para estudiar e investigar ciencias militares ultramodernas con la enorme base de datos y el sistema de informatica de punta, deviene otra gran creacion de la epoca del Songun que manifiesta la potencialidad intelectual de Corea, senalo.
					
					Al ver la estanteria de libros como los en formato digital y los normales, periodicos y revistas, el Mariscal vaticino que vendrian aqui muchos lectores.
					
					Continuo que el pabellon y la biblioteca son lugares imprescindibles para armar el EPC con las originales estrategias y tacticas coreanas tomando en cuenta las caracteristicas de guerra moderna y las exigencias de la situacion aguda y mejorar trascendentalmente su preparacion tecnico-militar.
					
					Hay que levantar mucho mas construcciones de la epoca del Songun que convengan a la tendencia estetica y la demanda del pueblo coreano, asevero y prosiguio que para ese fin, es necesario inventar nuevas, originales y tipicas formas de arquitectura y asegurar el caracter plastico.
					
					A continuacion, el Comandante Supremo recorrio varios salones y la exhibicion al aire libre del pabellon.
					
					Vio con profunda atencion los armamentos exhibidos recordando los ingentes esfuerzos de los Generalisimos quienes considerando el fortalecimiento de fuerzas armadas como asunto importante para defender el destino del pais y la nacion y el socialismo, concedieron preferencia al desarrollo de industria de defensa nacional para pertrechar el EPC con modernas armas y equipos tecnicos de combate.
					
					Instruyo producir mucho mas armamentos sofisticados capaces de doblegar a cualesquier enemigos al concentrar las fuerzas al desarrollo de la industria belica en acato a la idea del PTC de dar prioridad a los asuntos militares, y elevar sin parar el nivel de modernizacion de armas y los equipos tecnicos de combate del EPC.
					
					Contemplando el pabellon desde el mirador nuevamente construido, presento las tareas importantes que se presentan en el mantenimiento y la gestion.
					
					El Mariscal fue acompanado en esta ocasion por Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Paek Se Bong, Han Kwang Sang, Han Kwang Bok, Pak Thae Song, Kim Pyong Ho y Ma Won Chun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de Choummaly Sayasone
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje de Choummaly Sayasone
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio un mensaje de felicitacion que le remitiera Choummaly Sayasone, presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Querido camarada.
					
					Con motivo del 64o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, extiendo calidas felicitaciones y mejores votos a Vd., por su conducto, al Partido del Trabajo de Corea, al gobierno coreano y a todo el hermano pueblo coreano en nombre del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao, el gobierno y pueblo laosianos y en el mio propio.
					
					Complacido de que las excelentes y tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RDPL y la RPDC se desarrollen en la nueva fase mas alta, expreso la seguridad de que esos lazos se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran cada dia mas conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de ambos paises y a la paz, estabilidad y colaboracion de la region y el mundo.
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad jubilosa, deseo que Vd. tenga buena salud y felicidad y siga logrando grandes y nuevas victorias en el cumplimiento de su sagrada causa de dirigir la lucha por la defensa y la construccion del socialismo en la RPDC y la reunificacion pacifica de Corea.
					
					Reciba el testimonio de mi mas alta consideracion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje del presidente de Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe mensaje del presidente de Myanmar

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Vietnam

articles.title: Jugadores coreanos logran exitos en campeonatos de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Jugadores coreanos logran exitos en campeonatos de Taekwondo
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Los jugadores coreanos obtuvieron exitos en el X Campeonato Mundial de Jovenes de Taekwondo y el V Campeonato Mundial de Veteranos de Taekwondo, efectuados del dia 20 al 26 de agosto en Tallin de Estonia.
					En los eventos participaron cientos de taekwondoistas de ambos sexos provenientes de 71 paises del mundo.
					
					Los coreanos ocuparon el primer lugar en la clasificacion general por paises.
					
					En el primer campeonato, la RPDC conquisto 18 medallas de oro, 2 de plata y 4 de bronce.

					En el segundo campeonato sobresalieron Ri Sun Ok, que ocupo el primer lugar en el pattern veterano y en el parrins individual (F) de categoria de 60kg del nivel de oro, y Kim Jong Sun quien se situo en el primer lugar en el parrins de categoria de 68kg del nivel de plata.
					
					Los taekwondocas coreanos repatriaron el primero de septiembre.

articles.title: Portavoz de la UEC denuncia a las autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Portavoz de la UEC denuncia a las autoridades surcoreanas
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En entrevista con la ACNC concedida con motivo de que la banda de traidores surcoreanos planea convertir la Conferencia Internacional de Pluma, a ser inaugurada en el Sur de Corea, en un escenario de la ofensiva anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el tema de "derechos humanos", el portavoz del Comite Central de la Union de Escritores de Corea dio este sabado la siguiente respuesta:
					La banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak trata de lanzar una intensa ofensiva anti-RPDC en el tema de "DDHH" aprovechando la Conferencia Internacional de Pluma que tendra lugar en el Sur de Corea a mediados de septiembre.
					
					Diciendo abiertamente que "planean dar destaque al problema de DDHH del Norte de Corea" en ese conclave, los traidores surcoreanos tratan de afiliar al Club Internacional de Pluma una entidad conspiradora llamada "Centro de plumas exiliadas del Norte de Corea", integrado por una chusma. Ademas, tienen previsto escenificar una farsa anti-RPDC instigando a los intrigantes del centro a publicar sus "obras" y ofrecer "funciones".
					
					Toman parte en esta maniobra anti-RPDC las autoridades titeres y hasta los candidatos "presidenciales" del "Partido Saenuri".
					
					El caso significa un insoportable insulto y burla a las sagradas actividades literarias que toman por su principio vital la justicia, la conciencia y la verdad, y otra muestra de gran confrontacion con la RPDC.
					
					El Comite Central de la UEC denuncia categoricamente el nuevo complot anti-RPDC estigmatizandolo de acto anti-reunificacion e inmoral que ensucia la civilizacion y la sinceridad de la humanidad y agrava el enfrentamiento entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					La banda de Lee Myung Bak ni siquiera tiene derecho a hablar de los DDHH.
					
					En la actualidad los surcoreanos no disfrutan de elemental libertad ni derechos humanos.
					
					Ella es la horda de malos y peores violadores de DDHH que degenero el Sur de Corea como infierno y tierra privada de DDHH practicando la infame gobernacion antipopular y reprimiendo salvajemente a los que libran justas actividades literarias y de prensa.
					
					Ahora llega al cielo en el Sur de Corea la indignacion del pueblo y la banda de traidores esta en la agonia.
					
					Es ridiculo que esos cadaveres vivos lanzaran todavia la campana anti-RPDC cuestionando a alguien y movilizando hasta las escorias humanas.
					
					La Conferencia Internacional de Pluma no debe ser usada en los siniestros objetivos de los traidores surcoreanos enloquecidos por enfrentarse con la RPDC.
					
					Lo que debe atender ese conclave es la fea situacion de prensa y DDHH del Sur de Corea donde se violan flagrantemente la libertad de expresion y hasta los elementales derechos del hombre.
					
					Si la conferencia hace vista gorda de esa realidad y se usa en los siniestros objetivos conflictivos de la banda de Lee, mancharia el ideal y la imagen del Club Internacional de Pluma que aspira a una comunidad de escritores de talla mundial.
					
					Los literatos de conciencia del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar y toda la nacion coreana no deben perdonar jamas el intento criminal de la camarilla de Lee de convertir esa reunion internacional en escenario de enfrentamiento fratricida.
					
					Esperamos que la imparcial opinion publica y los eruditos del mundo rechacen ese complot anti-RPDC y apoyen y respalden la lucha de la nacion coreana por la reconciliacion, la unidad y la reunificacion.

articles.title: Politica hostil de EE.UU. es escollo principal al problema nuclear (I)
articles.content:
Politica hostil de EE.UU. es escollo principal al problema nuclear (I)
						
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publico el 31 de agosto un memorando intitulado "La politica hostil a la RPDC de Estados Unidos es el escollo principal para la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana".
					La ACNC transmite por partes su texto integro:
					
					El 20 de julio pasado, el MINREX declaro que la RPDC se vio obligada a revisar totalmente el problema nuclear debido a la recrudescente politica hostil de EE.UU.
					
					Esta politica es el factor que convirtio la Peninsula Coreana en la zona mas candente del mundo y el escollo principal a la paz duradera y seguridad.
					
					El problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana tambien es producto de la politica hostil y por eso, su solucion depende de la cancelacion de la misma por parte de EE.UU.
					
					El MINREX de la RPDC publica este memorando para revelar que el reciente dicho de la administracion norteamericana de no tener la voluntad de hostilizar a la RPDC dista mucho de sus acciones.
						
					
					1. Concepcion hostil impide la solucion del problema nuclear
						
					
					El 29 de febrero de 2012, se ha publicado un importante acuerdo logrado en las conversaciones de alto nivel RPDC-EE.UU. 
					
					EE.UU. reafirmo que "no tiene la voluntad de hostilizar a la RPDC y esta dispuesto a tomar las medidas para mejorar las relaciones bilaterales en el espiritu de respeto mutuo a la soberania y la igualdad." y decidio suministrar a segunda una gran cantidad de alimentos.
					
					Por su parte, la RPDC se comprometio a interrumpir temporalmente el ensayo nuclear, el lanzamiento de misiles de larga distancia y las actividades de enriquecimiento de uranio en lo que marchen las conversaciones tomando en consideracion la preocupacion de EE.UU. 
					
					Sin embargo, cuando la RPDC lanzo el 13 de abril el satelite artificial con fines pacificos "Kwangmyongsong-3", EE.UU. quebro unilateralmente el acuerdo del 29 de febrero e intensifico la sancion anti-RPDC censurando que eso fue lanzamiento hecho con la tecnologia igual a la del misil de largo alcance. 
					
					Es verdad que son parecidas la tecnologia del transportador de satelite artificial y la del misil portador de ojiva. 
					
					EE.UU. no habia censurado de esa manera ni sancionado antes a otros paises por el lanzamiento de satelite artificial. 
					
					A EE.UU. le parecio como misil de largo alcance, que se lanzaria contra su pais, el cohete transportador de satelite artificial de la RPDC, porque la considera como su enemiga. 
					
					Asi se ha roto sin implementarse el acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU., alcanzado por primera vez desde la aparicion de la administracion Obama, al igual que todos los acuerdos bilaterales anteriores. 
					
					Cuando se abrieron las primeras conversaciones RPDC-EE.UU. durante la administracion Clinton, EE.UU. prometio a la RPDC "no usar las fuerzas armadas incluyendo armas nucleares ni amenazarla con las mismas" (fuente: la Declaracion Conjunta RPDC-EE.UU. publicada el 11 de junio de 1993)
					
					Al final de las conversaciones, afirmo que "se moveria por normalizar totalmente las relaciones politicas y economicas con la RPDC." (Acuerdo Basico RPDC-EE.UU. del 21 de octubre de 1994)
					
					Despues, EE.UU. declaro que no va a tener la intencion hostil a la RPDC. (Comunicado Conjunto RPDC-EE.UU. publicado el 12 de octubre de 2000)
					
					Pero todas esas promesas fueron incumplidas e invalidadas de la noche a la manana al cambiarse la administracion norteamericana.
					
					La administracion Bush revoco todos los acuerdos entre la RPDC y EE.UU. alcanzados durante el mandato de su antecesora y definio a la RPDC como "eje del mal" y blanco de ataque preventivo nuclear. (mensaje del ano nuevo del presidente estadounidense publicado 30 de enero de 2002 y reporte de revision del estado nuclear publicado en marzo de 2002)
					
					La peligrosa politica hostil de la administracion Bush obligo a la RPDC a retirarse totalmente del Tratado de No Proliferacion (TNP) y emplear la industria energetica nuclear de caracter pacifico fundada con el objetivo de producir la electricidad en la preparacion del disuasivo nuclear para la autodefensa.
					
					Al iniciarse las conversaciones a 6 bandas, EE.UU. afirmo que "no tiene la voluntad de atacar o invadir a la RPDC con las armas nucleares o las convencionales." (Declaracion Conjunta publicada el 19 de septiembre de 2005 en esa cita)
					
					Como las medidas de accion para ejecutar la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre, EE.UU. prometio varias veces mejorar las relaciones bilaterales con la RPDC y establecer perfectas relaciones diplomaticas. (acuerdos alcanzados el 13 de febrero y el 3 de octubre de 2007 en las conversaciones a 6 bandas)
					
					Pero esta platica no se reanuda todavia por 4 anos despues de su ultima ronda en diciembre de 2008 y en ese periodo, EE.UU. elevo el grado de hostilidad a la RPDC.
					
					La primera medida tomada por la administracion Obama sobre Corea fue cuestionar de manera discriminada el lanzamiento del satelite artificial con fines pacificos "Kwangmyongsong-2".
					
					La extremada politica hostil encaminada a privar a la RPDC del derecho soberano al uso pacifico del cosmos, reconocido por el derecho internacional, produjo la reaccion para la autodefensa de prueba nuclear, lo cual desato el circulo vicioso de desconfianza y enfrentamiento como la sancion contra la RPDC y el inicio de la construccion por cuenta propia de la central de reactores de agua ligera y la aceleracion de produccion de uranio enriquecido como combustible.
					
					La realidad demuestra que si no se elimina totalmente la arraigada concepcion hostil a la RPDC de EE.UU., no se puede resolver ningun problema y al contrario, aumentara solo el peligro de enfrentamiento y conflicto.
					
					Al principio del dialogo RPDC-EE.UU. la primera insistio en que si EE.UU. renuncia primero su politica hostil, sera posible la solucion del problema nuclear mientras el segundo abogo por que la primera renuncie primero las armas nucleares para normalizar las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					En ese curso, gracias a la sinceridad y magnanimidad de la RPDC, se presento el principio de accion simultanea: "palabra por palabra" y "accion por accion", el cual devino la base del dialogo.
					
					Pero, 20 anos de las conversaciones RPDC-EE.UU. ensenan que el principio de accion simultanea no puede ser efectivo si no se elimina primero la concepcion hostil de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC.
